Package sait.sll.utility

Interface LinkedListADT

Record Components:
Object - The reference data type the linked list will contain.
All Known Implementing Classes:
SLL
public interface LinkedListADT
Abstract data type for a linked list.
Version:
25-03-2021
Author:

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void append​(java.lang.Object data)
    Adds to the end of the list.
    void clear()
    Clears the list.
    boolean contains​(java.lang.Object data)
    Go through elements and check if we have one with data.
    void delete​(int index)
    Removes element at index from list, reducing the size.
    int indexOf​(java.lang.Object data)
    Gets the first index of element containing data.
    void insert​(java.lang.Object data, int index)
    Adds a new element at a specific position.
    boolean isEmpty()
    Checks if the list is empty.
    void prepend​(java.lang.Object data)
    Prepends (adds to beginning) data to the list.
    void replace​(java.lang.Object data, int index)
    Replaces the data at index.
    java.lang.Object retrieve​(int index)
    Gets the data at the specified index.
    int size()
    Gets the number of elements in the list.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the list is empty.
      Returns:
      True if it is empty.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears the list.

    • append

      void append​(java.lang.Object data) throws java.io.IOException
      Adds to the end of the list.
      Parameters:
      data - Data to append.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      java.io.IOException

    • prepend

      void prepend​(java.lang.Object data)
      Prepends (adds to beginning) data to the list.
      Parameters:
      data - Data to store inside element.

    • insert

      void insert​(java.lang.Object data, int index) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Adds a new element at a specific position.
      Parameters:
      data - Data that element is to contain.
      index - Index to add new element at.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is negative or past the size of the list.

    • replace

      void replace​(java.lang.Object data, int index) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Replaces the data at index.
      Parameters:
      data - Data to replace.
      index - Index of element to replace.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is negative or larger than size - 1 of list.

    • size

      int size()
      Gets the number of elements in the list.
      Returns:
      Size of list (0 meaning empty)

    • delete

      void delete​(int index) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Removes element at index from list, reducing the size.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of element to remove.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is negative or past the size - 1.

    • retrieve

      java.lang.Object retrieve​(int index) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Gets the data at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of element to get.
      Returns:
      Data in element or null if it was not found.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is negative or larger than size - 1 of the list.
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

    • indexOf

      int indexOf​(java.lang.Object data)
      Gets the first index of element containing data.
      Parameters:
      data - Data object to find the first index of.
      Returns:
      First of index of element with matching data or -1 if not found.

    • contains

      boolean contains​(java.lang.Object data)
      Go through elements and check if we have one with data.
      Parameters:
      data - Data object to search for.
      Returns:
      True if element exists with value.
